Inspired by the HEROICS of the @Lionesses -  a display with some recommended reads to learn more about women's football, including a QR code directly to the FA 'For All' page to learn more, find out where to watch the WSL, and how to get involved at grassroots level⚽️🏆#education https://t.co/sEe80iW1kQ
Great end of term leaving speeches @verulamschool #VerulamFoLife https://t.co/YqAW3OwyC9

Weird way to spend a hot July Sunday! Adapting ‘A Christmas Carol’ for @verulamschool winter show. Lifelong dream to do it and we have super talented students and an excellent Scrooge! Very excited! #charlesdickens https://t.co/TORpPswazo

Y9 Trip- students now enjoying a spot of lunch after a great morning at @BCLivingMuseum learning about the impact of gas on coal miners in the industrial revolution. The key enquiry question for lunch - were chips from the 1800s better? #verulamukhistorytour #history @AngliaTours https://t.co/OKWeWtpki1

Had amazing experience at the @BCLivingMuseum learning about work and life in Industrial Britain! It was even the film set for the #PeakyBlinders! Boys have been excellently engaged, while others met the double for Arthur Shelby in the series! @AngliaTours #verulamukhitorytour https://t.co/4SeYRsNZWf

An afternoon at the National Memorial Arboretum, ending with a reflective memorial service laying a poppy wreath to those who gave their lives since WW2. Two Y9’s - Tanaka and Gaurav - gave two beautiful readings. Lest We Forget #remembrance #verulamukhistorytour @AngliaTours https://t.co/0ZPCYvPzDu
Part of our WW1 trench experience today at the Staffordshire Regiment Museum! #verulamukhistorytour #ww1history #ww1 #verulamforlife @AngliaTours https://t.co/fvRYy2OMzy

A day spent at the Staffordshire Regiment Museum, with a WW1 trench experience and museum. Boys learned many aspects to life as a British Tommy #verulamukhistorytour @AngliaTours #history #WW1 https://t.co/mpD5F9EyYd
Now for an evening of bowling!! Which member of staff has already only scored strikes?! ❌ 🎳 https://t.co/bBjf1d71SN

A solemn & atmospheric visit to the German Military Cemetery including the graves of 4 Zeppelin crews that were shot down over Britain, and a 1 year old German internee from the Isle of Man whose father was sadly fighting for Britain #uverulamukhistorytour #history @AngliaTours https://t.co/jYGZPs3NRm

A reflective visit to a British War Cemetery, where the first 4 graves amongst 100’s were soldiers from Hertfordshire, India, New Zealand & Ireland - highlighting the global nature of WW1. Now on route to the hotel for a buffet dinner 👀 #verulamukhistorytour @AngliaTours https://t.co/0mK6MSzVwQ

Excellent start to the day looking at basic training for a recruit who would have joined up to serve in 1914. #verulamukhistorytour #history a real officer amongst us @AngliaTours would these boys pass the test? https://t.co/FgL1KTyhMW

Beginning with discussions about why WW1 broke out in 1914 before a day of World War One learning, including the role that Cannock Chase played in soldier training and the casualty evacuation process 👍🏛 #verulamukhistorytour #history brilliant engaging guide @AngliaTours https://t.co/kUFu3qWmtO

Y9’s safely arrived at Liverpool Street - ready for our first stop at the Kindertransport Memorial - how typical was the Kindertransport as a British reaction to Jewish migrants over time? #history @verulamschool #verulamukhistorytour https://t.co/w6HonjV4up
Having just had the privilege to view the historic battle of cable street mural, students are taking a well earned lunch break! https://t.co/g9AuGRijlY

On route to @I_W_M after a fantastic walking tour - highlights include Brune Street (Soup Kitchen for Jewish Poor), Spitalfields WW1 memorial, Bonhoeffer and resistance against Nazis and the Battle of Cable Street Mural 👌 Some amazing questions being asked #verulamukhistorytour https://t.co/AAcxXFmWBy

Y9 History Trip - on route back to Verulam - rough ETA 17:45. 

A historical afternoon spent at the Imperial War Museum after a morning exploring Jewish migration in London. Boys have been ambassadors today #verulamforlife #verulamukhistorytour https://t.co/FMqr1KIBwW

Amazing day so far looking at Jewish migration in London, with a particular focus on WW2 #verulamukhistorytour boys are highly engaged with the brilliant guides from @AngliaTours #history @verulamschool https://t.co/uYEZf5WVSQ
Team PE are underway for Blue Peris 22🙌🏻👏🏻💙 https://t.co/oMl61HZCBO
Excellent @AlbanAcdTrust blended learning session @SandEdTech @RidgewayTeaches @Verulearning 👌 https://t.co/AsR8On2pIt

So proud of our year 12 @verulamschool mathematicians  mentoring some of our KS3 students in our library. A perfect environment to get to know each other and to enjoy studying maths @Verulam6thForm @Verulearning #VerulamForLife https://t.co/qjNrkAlMa7

What a busy day it’s been in maths! It’s now time for @verulamschool year 8 students to compete in the @HertsLearning maths challenge. Great team work on display from our 2 teams! #VerulamForLife https://t.co/USrMoE4fNB

Love teaching our Summer Term sports. Athletics, handball and tennis on the go💪🏻 🏐🎾🏹

Lots of new learning for the students with some trying these for the first time💪🏻 https://t.co/QBrDYHu4RT

Members of the Rock Choir rehearsing. Our music groups are getting bigger by the week so it's an exciting time! Want the audio with our fab drummer, guitarists and pianist? You'll have to come to our join Music & Drama evening in July 😉#verulamforlife #teachingmusic #choir https://t.co/sa40CEzIJc

Further #pedagogy work from another #VGL6 class @Verulam6thForm as they to use @antbaxter to debate the reasons and impacts of how #regeneratingplaces create conflicts in rural communities. https://t.co/HcXDUbWgdS

With our Year 9s completing an excellent 3-0 victory this afternoon in their Semifinal Vs Roundwood, we can confirm that we have 3/5 year groups present for the District Finals.

Year 8/9/11 will all be competing next Tuesday at Woollams for their respective District titles👊🏻⚽️💙

Well done to the Year 8 side who beat Beaumont 4-2 to advance to the District Cup Final👏🏻 They join the 11s as double finalists in both the District and County Cups. MOM Ben B

Commiseration’s to our Year 7s lost to a good Roundwood side in their Semi-Final today.

⚽️💙

Congrats to the Year 11 Football Side who won their District Semi-Final in a tense penalty shootout Vs @BeaumontPE! 1-1 (0-3). Thanks for hosting and a well fought battle on the pitch. 

This result sees the 11s book their place in both the County and District Cup Final👏🏻💙 https://t.co/7K0sXXQHw0
